definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: About eight of these massive ships leave every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天大约有八艘这样的巨轮驶离港口。

sentences.english: People on shore greeted the new 10,000 liner by waving their arms as it was getting up.
sentences.chinese: 当新造的万吨巨轮驶近时，岸上的人们挥臂欢迎。

sentences.english: After the alarm had been given , the great ship turned sharply to avoid a direct collision.
sentences.chinese: 警报响起后，巨轮紧急转舵以避免直接碰撞。

sentences.english: The great ship ploughed across the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 巨轮在大洋中破浪前进。

sentences.english: Sponsors of the shipbuilding project were invited to the launching ceremony of a huge ocean-going ship.
sentences.chinese: 造船工程项目的赞助者们应邀出席远洋巨轮下水典礼。

sentences.english: Despatch is the soul of business.
sentences.chinese: 礼貌是商务巨轮的润滑油。

sentences.english: Newton was the ship in the great ocean of life.
sentences.chinese: 牛顿是航行在生命之海的巨轮。

sentences.english: Is China's titanic economy finally running into the iceberg of overcapacity?
sentences.chinese: 国经济巨轮终于撞上产能过剩的冰山了吗？

sentences.english: The wheel of history cannot be pushed back.
sentences.chinese: 历史的巨轮是拖不回来的。

sentences.english: The wheels of industry must be kept turning.
sentences.chinese: 工业的巨轮必须不停顿地运转。

sentences.english: The wheel of history cannot be turned back.
sentences.chinese: 历史的巨轮是拖不回来的。

sentences.english: Radio the tankers and order them back to port.
sentences.chinese: 无线电通知巨轮油船命令它们回港。

sentences.english: The great ship was like a floating building.
sentences.chinese: 那艘巨轮活像一幢浮动的大楼。

sentences.english: IN 2007, the great ship of the American economy began encountering darkening skies.
sentences.chinese: 2007年，美国经济这艘巨轮的航程开始风云突变。

definition: to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions
to set sail/to brave the waves
to set sail on a voyage to a distant place/(fig.) to undertake a great mission
Chinese treasure ship, a type of large sailing ship in the fleet of Ming dynasty admiral Zheng He 鄭和|郑和[Zheng4 He2]
